channel.title: Inquirer.com
channel.description: The latest staff content from The Philadelphia Inquirer

image.title: The latest staff content from The Philadelphia Inquirer

item.title: Why the Philadelphia airport hosted a job fair for trans and nonbinary folks
item.description: The trans community has focused on healthcare and social services, but rarely on issues of economic justice, said Marcus Iannozzi, a business owner who founded a program to connect trans folks with job opportunities.

item.title: Felix Sandstrom, Pascal Laberge and Flyers to face Islanders in rookie game in Allentown
item.description: The highly touted top rookie line of Morgan Frost, Joel Farabee and Isaac Ratcliffe also will take part in the game Wednesday night.

item.title: They like both. So how are New Hampshire liberals picking between neighbors Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren?
item.description: Supporters of Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren show largely mutual admiration of the candidates and similar assessments of their strengths — the differences come down to which qualities each voter prioritized.

item.title: VP Mike Pence pledges ‘debt of honor’ to Flight 93 victims at 9/11 memorial in Western Pa.
item.description: Pence, who spoke at the annual event in 2017, will honor the 40 passengers and crew members of United Airlines Flight 93 who disrupted an attack on Washington, D.C., by fighting back against hijackers.

item.title: Climate change is hurting Philadelphians’ health, and the worst is yet to come
item.description: The killer heat wave of 1993 changed how the city treats its most vulnerable residents. As temperatures continue to rise, more action will be required.

item.title: Experts offer suicide prevention advice in the wake of Penn psychologist’s death
item.description: Signs of mental health distress can be difficult to spot. Here are some tips for how to recognize whether a friend or family member is in need, and what you can do to help.

item.title: A new law in California could be the start of a dystopic arms race, or the end of the NCAA | David Murphy
item.description: We’re talking about the transformation of college sports into a real life video game for millionaire and billionaire sports fans. At the state level, this would have the same impact as Citizens United on the political process. In fact, the Political Action Committee model is the most logical outcome

item.title: Sea what’s cooking: Seafood boils are now a thing | Let’s Eat
item.description: Also: Dock Street's new tasting room and a family-style diner out of the way in King of Prussia.

item.title: Grading report cards: What’s in an A?
item.description: How much weight should parents give their kids’ report cards? It depends.

item.title: 2 more Philly cops to be fired in Facebook probe, bringing total to 15
item.description: Acting Philadelphia Police Commissioner Christine M. Coulter said Tuesday that 15 police officers had been suspended with intent to dismiss for making offensive Facebook posts — two more than the Police Department had announced in July.

item.title: Carson Wentz press conference, 11:50 a.m. | Live video
item.description: Wentz will take questions from reporters about the Week 1 win over the Redskins and Sunday's Week 2 matchup in Atlanta.

item.title: Reassessment: Eagles will be NFC’s best team; Carson Wentz, league MVP | Marcus Hayes
item.description: With deft passes, perfect footwork, flawless mechanics, superb decision, and no panic, the franchise QB took a final step Sunday, and his team will just get better around him.

item.title: The secret life of a football star; Nurses in Pa. are fed up | Morning Newsletter
item.description: All the local news you need to know to start your day, delivered straight to your email.

item.title: Meet Philly’s unsung forefather of jazz. And on Friday, listen to his music in a free live show.
item.description: Francis Johnson was the entertainer of choice for elite Philadelphia society in the 1800s. His legacy is being revived by the Library Company of Philadelphia.

item.title: Little green women soldiers are coming soon, thanks to a Scranton company and a 6-year-old girl
item.description: The female toy soldiers will be available by Christmas 2020, and current designs include a woman captain with a handgun and a "bazooka woman."

item.title: Drink wine made the qvevri way at Jet Wine Bar’s Georgian BBQ
item.description: Georgians say their country is the land of 8,000 vintages. Try a bunch of them on Sunday.

item.title: Harm reduction saves lives now and in the future | Opinion
item.description: As an emergency physician, I've seen Philadelphia make great strides in using harm reduction to save and improve lives.

item.title: Philly is among the worst U.S. cities for Gen Z, report says
item.description: The biggest reason Philly didn't score higher? Safety.

item.title: This Dungeons & Dragons-inspired coffee casts a spell on Philadelphia roasters
item.description: Two friends and former baristas named their small-batch coffee company after a spell used in D&D games.

item.title: Alleged Philly Ponzi schemer Brenda Smith’s largest investor lost $46,000,000 and now levels new charges
item.description: Once a Rittenhouse Square resident, Brenda Smith is now a federal inmate. Her largest investor just filed a lawsuit alleging she had help stealing tens of millions of dollars.

item.title: Penn State-Pittsburgh: Facts and figures on the college football rivalry
item.description: The teams are set to meet at noon Saturday at Beaver Stadium.

item.title: PhillyBloco to celebrate its first Brazilian summer carnival
item.description: The 11-year-old Brazilian music group will welcome 15 additional drumming students from Unidos da Filadelfia to its 20-member band of percussionists, dancers, and singers.

item.title: Pa. nurses are fed up with hold times, rude answers, and delays dealing with state licensing board
item.description: A review of all licensing boards ordered by Gov. Tom Wolf found that the nursing board’s initial processing time averaged 17 days. But when pressed, acting Secretary of State Kathy Boockvar said she has “no confidence” in that number.

item.title: After 9/11, Philadelphia had the quiet poignancy of Phillies announcer Harry Kalas
item.description: “It was a real emotional night, and Harry was a wonderful shepherd through moments like that,” former Phillies broadcaster Scott Graham said in a biography about Kalas.

item.title: NBC’s ‘This Is Us’ spotted filming in Philly
item.description: Star Lyric Ross was spotted near Headhouse Square.

item.title: Judge called him a ‘ticking time bomb.’ Now he faces retrial in 2013 shooting of Philly cop.
item.description: Eric Torres was convicted of aggravated assault and weapons offenses in the shooting of Officer Edward Davies and was sentenced to 66 to 132 years. The state Superior Court ordered a new trial after finding that officers did not have probable cause to search Torres' home after the shooting.

item.title: Will the Penn State-Pittsburgh college football rivalry continue past Saturday? Former players hope so.
item.description: The two teams will play for the 100th time on Saturday. There is no game scheduled for the next five years. Penn State coach James Franklin said any future game has to "make sense for both parties."

item.title: Eagles near the top on all NFL power rankings lists ... except one
item.description: Even FS1 host and Philly sports troll Colin Cowherd is high on the Eagles, calling Carson Wentz "magic" and DeSean Jackson unguardable.

item.title: Former Phillies pitching coach Rick Kranitz feeling just fine in his home with the Braves | Bob Brookover
item.description: The Phillies fired pitching coach Rick Kranitz in November and he admits he was "mad" at the time. That anger has subsided and the 60-year-old pitching coach is about to reach the postseason for just the second time in his career.

item.title: Teen’s path to a top music school included the U.S. Open, Patti LaBelle, and a bold audition | We The People
item.description: She started singing Jill Scott songs when she was 18 months old. Now she’s headed to Berklee on a full scholarship.

item.title: Cajun-style seafood boils — with South Asian flair — are shaking up Philly’s shellfish scene
item.description: Most of the restaurants serve the meals in plastic bags that, when sliced open, perfume the casual dining rooms with the aromas of garlic and Old Bay — and sometimes ginger and scallions.

item.title: Flight 93 site a fitting memorial to the souls lost on 9/11 | Opinion
item.description: Time passes but the sadness remains. And yet, the story told by the brave souls who rest there is one of selfless unity. Listen to their voices.

item.title: Political Cartoon: Trump rescues the Bahamas
item.description: Daily takes from Pulitzer Prize-winning cartoonist Signe Wilkinson.

item.title: Demolition looms for hulking Penn’s Landing artifact of ill-fated sky tram to Camden
item.description: Delaware River Waterfront Corp. is seeking bids from contractors to demolish the tramway tower near Penn’s Landing’s Great Plaza amphitheater.

item.title: Bringing back Corey Dickerson next season could be complicated for Phillies | Extra Innings
item.description: The Phillies are better with Dickerson on the roster, but bringing him back is a bit complicated. He'll be a free agent after the season, and other teams are likely to pursue him.

item.title: The Parent Trip: Natalie Catin-St. Louis and Numa St. Louis, of Mount Airy
item.description: "Every circumstance affecting a child looks different now."

item.title: Tuna sandwiches could be out as Cherry Hill school district proposes changes to lunch policy
item.description: Instead, students would have the option to select a hot lunch from the meal of the day menu available to paying students. They would not, however, be allowed to select a la carte items, such as snacks.

item.title: Woman, 23, fatally shot in North Philly
item.description: Police say the woman may have been struck by stray gunfire.

item.title: How parents can help their kids avoid college campus outbreaks
item.description: When our teenagers go to college we want them to acquire many things: New friends with diverse backgrounds, expanded interests, more independence, and, if they have time, an education. What we don’t want them to get? Sick. In an outbreak.

item.title: Football star, pro wrestler, American spy: Joe Savoldi’s improbable life
item.description: Savoldi was a football star at Notre Dame and played his final game for the Fighting Irish at Franklin Field. A scandal started him on a life, shrouded in secrecy, that still seems too remarkable to be true.

item.title: Drexel is prepared to take charge of Philadelphia History Museum holdings
item.description: Plan for huge transfer of public collection to private university will see increased online and public access, officials say.

item.title: On the market: A Victorian house near the Penn campus for $880,000
item.description: The house, believed to date to the 1890s, retains most of its original features, including wood floors, carved arches and mantelpieces, and original leaded and stained glass windows.

item.title: With Eagles’ Malik Jackson out, enter Akeem Spence | Early Birds
item.description: Who is the Eagles' new defensive tackle?

item.title: Interim Philly police commissioner Christine Coulter apologizes for controversial T-shirt; Councilwoman Cindy Bass calls for resignation
item.description: “I am profoundly sorry that anything I would’ve done could’ve caused such hurt,” Christine M. Coulter said during a City Council hearing, 10 days after The Inquirer reported she wore a T-shirt in the 1990s bearing the words “L.A.P.D. We Treat You Like a King.”

item.title: Representing charters and Muslim women: Meet Philly’s newest school board members
item.description: Doha Ibrahim and Imere Williams will formally become student representatives to the school board later this month.

item.title: Temple women sound off about the field hockey game they didn’t finish — because of fireworks for football team
item.description: “Yeah, I think it’s frustrating — I think that’s the best adjective to use,” said Temple field hockey player Lucy Reed.

item.title: How long is a life sentence? For Pennsylvania’s Supreme Court, a philosophical quandary.
item.description: Do you consult actuarial tables to assess life expectancy? Reference the national age of retirement? Or gauge the chances of coming home with some quality of life remaining?

item.title: Triple Bottom Brewing taps a socially conscious side of the beer business
item.description: The new brewery on Spring Garden Street is "bigger than beer," the owners say.

item.title: Horoscopes: Wednesday, September 11, 2019
item.description: Daily Horoscopes

item.title: Can a sleek, new Comcast call center in Delaware improve customer service?
item.description: Comcast says it can improve its customer service by improving its worker experience.

item.title: Dear Abby | Backup boyfriend can’t say no to teacher he’s in love with
item.description: DEAR ABBY: I’m a 39-year-old gay male who was in a relationship with a very attractive 44-year-old teacher. He never wanted to commit to a monogamous relationship. After 10 months of seeing each other, he informed me that he is about to enter into a relationship with a 22-year-old. He said it was n

item.title: Phillies slip past Braves, tie season high with five home runs
item.description: Corey Dickerson slugged two home runs. J.T. Realmuto and Bryce Harper hit one apiece and Scott Kingery had an inside-the-park home run.

item.title: New Kinetic 4K Scoreboard, Center City Club, unveiled at Wells Fargo Center
item.description: Officials say it is the largest scoreboard of its kind in the world with kinetic capabilities,

item.title: 3 women struck by vehicle in South Philly
item.description: The accident occcured just before 7:50 p.m. in the 1100 block of Washington Avenue.

item.title: Tuesday’s Southeastern Pa. roundup: Notre Dame field hockey rolls past Archbishop Carroll
item.description: The Irish field hockey team exploded for five goals in the first half on their way to a 7-0 win over Archbishop Carroll.

item.title: Tuesday’s South Jersey roundup: Sydney Farnham helps Haddon Township girls’ soccer top Lindenwold
item.description: Danielle Bishop recorded one goal and two assists in Haddon Township's win over Lindenwold.

item.title: After fire, Philadelphia refinery paid executives $4,591,500 in bonuses while hundreds were laid off
item.description: Philadelphia Energy Solutions paid out bonuses to key executives after announcing most of the refinery's 1,100 employees would be laid off without severance or health benefits.

item.title: Report: Antonio Brown accused of rape in lawsuit
item.description: The lawsuit was filed in Florida by Britney Taylor, alleging three incidents between June 2017 and May 2018.

item.title: Painted Bride says it must sell its building with its famous Zagar mosaics to the highest bidder
item.description: The art center cannot sustain itself without maximizing the value of its building, leaders argued in Orphans' Court, depsite the fact that the sale will almost certainly result in the destruction of the murals covering the building facade.

item.title: FTC threatens action against CBD companies making bogus health claims
item.description: There are no CBD products that are proven to treat cancer, Alzheimer's, schizophrenia, or arthritis. Epidiolex, CBD derived from marijuana, can be used to treat some rare forms epilepsy.

item.title: Phillies rookie Adam Haseley isn’t getting many chances to face lefties, even though he had success against them in minors
item.description: It's part of the balance of competing for a wild-card spot and furthering a young player's development, according to manager Gabe Kapler.

item.title: As Congress debates PFAS measures, lawmakers press 3M, DuPont, Chemours on chemicals they used
item.description: Lawmakers in Congress are still debating a defense spending bill that could include provisions for cleaning up PFAS. Meanwhile, 3M, DuPont, and Chemours appeared before a House committee to discuss the chemicals.

item.title: Gov. Phil Murphy to gun industry and banks: Get behind gun control or lose state’s business
item.description: New Jersey officials said the state is using its purchasing power to hold the gun industry accountable.

item.title: Ann Louise Strong, 89, Penn professor who taught environmental law and regional planning
item.description: Professor Strong proposed using special laws to allow for growth while protecting the natural resources and beauty of an area. Then she ran into an obstacle: property owners.

item.title: James Franklin recognizes importance of Pitt game to Penn State football alumni and fans
item.description: The Nittany Lions coach still reminded everyone that the 100th meeting of the intrastate rivals is just like any other week in terms of preparing for the next opponent.

item.title: Camden nuclear firm Holtec diversifies into renewable-energy battery systems
item.description: Holtec International, the Camden energy firm primarily focused on nuclear power, has seen the future, and it is in the expanding market for renewable power.

item.title: Larry Kaiser steps down as CEO of Temple University Health System
item.description: The executive’s departure comes as the perennially struggling North Philadelphia health system is the midst of a restructuring that includes the pending sale of Fox Chase Cancer Center to Thomas Jefferson University.

item.title: Temple tight end Kenny Yeboah’s availability will be key against Maryland
item.description: The redshirt junior missed about three weeks of practice and Temple's opener, but he was full-go at practice Tuesday.

item.title: America’s poverty rate falls while household incomes remain the same
item.description: The Trump administration found much to praise in the Census reports, while poverty experts saw cracks and caveats among the flood of good-news statistics.

item.title: Blossoming Egor Zamula among Flyers on display in rookie game Wednesday vs. Islanders
item.description: Morgan Frost, Joel Farabee, Isaac Ratcliffe, Felix Sandstrom and Phil Myers also will be on the ice at the PPL Center in Allentown.

item.title: ‘September Days’: Inside the movement to bring Hong Kong-style protests to America | Will Bunch
item.description: A small but growing network of activists want to bring Hong Kong-style sustained protest to America. We ready?

item.title: Despite struggles of Phillies’ staff, Gabe Kapler defends work of first-year pitching coach Chris Young
item.description: Also, veteran reliever Pat Neshek undergoes season-ending surgery.

item.title: Eagles’ Carson Wentz was effective on the move Sunday, which was fine with his coaches
item.description: In training camp, the QB seemed to stick to the pocket exclusively.

item.title: Stray cornstalk in South Jersey sets Guinness Record with 29 cobs
item.description: Virginia and Matthew Jacovelli, of Deptford, are crediting a squirrel with planting the kernel that sprouted the record-breaking stalk.

item.title: Timmy Jernigan and Eagles’ defensive line depth will be tested, with Malik Jackson gone; Akeem Spence signed
item.description: In the short term, it would seem that Timmy Jernigan gets his starting job back.

item.title: First look inside the Melrose Diner, reopening Wednesday morning with a 12-hour discount
item.description: That kitschy mural of old-time Philadelphia is still there.

item.title: Center City’s Restaurant Week starts next Sunday. Here’s where you should make reservations.
item.description: From Center City standards like Tequilas to the recently relocated Townsend, here's where you should book a reservation.

item.title: Lane Johnson, Eagles offensive line expecting problems with Atlanta’s home crowd
item.description: The Birds have lost eight in a row in true road games in domed stadiums. Their only victory came after the 2017 season while they were playing on a neutral field. Perhaps you remember it.

item.title: Wawa to install solar panels at 93 stores across New Jersey
item.description: Wawa flipped a symbolic switch on a small solar farm Tuesday that will supply all the electricity to an adjacent store in Pemberton, Burlington County — one of 93 solar installations the company announced it plans to complete with SolareAmerica in New Jersey by the end of next year.

item.title: I shouted and Wobbled and vogued and ‘flocked’ on the streets of South Philly last weekend, and it was art
item.description: The "nomadic " Fringe Festival production "Úumbal" premiered on Saturday and repeats this coming weekend. Our writer is one of 44 community recruits out dancing in the streets.

item.title: Delco firehouse reopens, but there are still burning questions | Editorial
item.description: Issues of personal and public accountability raised by the Bon Air Fire Company controversy resonate far beyond the suburban Delaware County town of 50,000.

item.title: Penn State players experiencing latest installments of Pitt matchup from different perspective
item.description: Most of the current Penn State players weren't alive the last time the Nittany Lions regularly played Pitt in the 90s, but they've still had positive experiences playing the Panthers the last four years.

item.title: Hunger declines, but some fear Trump proposals could reverse the trend
item.description: Last year, 11.1% of U.S. households — around 14 million — were food insecure, defined as lacking enough food during the year to foster active, healthy living for a family. In 2017, that figure was 11.8%.

item.title: Basketball recruiting: Roman Catholic star Lynn Greer III plans to visit Temple
item.description: Greer is the son of former Temple great Lynn Greer II, who played under Hall of Fame coach John Chaney for five seasons.

item.title: Downsizing DuPont sells chip business for $450 million, spins off consultants
item.description: DuPont Co. sells a computer-supply business for $450 million and spins off its 'sustainabilty' group in an LBO

item.title: Here’s what $500 in Pizzeria Beddia’s private hoagie room buys you
item.description: Plus: Step-by-step instructions for building an Italian hoagie the Joe Beddia way.

item.title: Illegal sales of cigarettes to Philadelphia youth doubled in 2018
item.description: The rate of illegal sales to youth in Philadelphia is more than twice the state rate.

item.title: Philadelphia in for a steamy, 2-day return of summer starting Wednesday
item.description: Heat indexes are expected to be in the mid-90s Wednesday.

item.title: Union to face LAFC team that’s MLS best, and perhaps best ever
item.description: Saturday's game pits a Union team high up the standings on merit against an LAFC team that is atop MLS by miles.

item.title: Sixers: No discipline for Mike Scott after fight with Eagles fans
item.description: “This was an unfortunate and isolated incident, and it is in no way representative of the Philadelphia fan base as a whole," a Sixers spokesperson said.

item.title: The Kenney administration’s Trump-like new policy is bad for journalism — and Philly | Opinion
item.description: The City of Philadelphia’s new policy, which comes on the heels of a critical story about the city's DROP program, forbids city officials and staff from talking to Philadelphia magazine reporters without direct approval from the Mayor’s Chief of Staff.

item.title: ‘All my past is in my past’: At sentencing, ex-mob enforcer Philip Narducci says he’s left crime behind
item.description: After a life filled with Mafia hits and prison stints, a onetime mob enforcer turned restaurateur told a federal judge Tuesday he finally had traded in his crime family for a real one.

item.title: A Torresdale farm that was auctioned off for back taxes inspired a song by this Celtic folk-rock quartet
item.description: The River Drivers perform music steeped in working-class life Friday at a Irish music and dance festival in Mt. Airy.

item.title: Southeastern Pa. football rankings: Downingtown East, Neumann Goretti climb in Week 3 Top 10
item.description: St. Joseph's Prep, Downingtown West and La Salle hold down the top three spots in lineup after Week 3.

item.title: South Jersey football rankings: Shawnee, Lenape, Camden climb in Week 1 Top 10
item.description: St. Joseph, Williamstown and St. Augustine hold down the top three spots after the first full week of action.

item.title: Monday’s Southeastern Pa. roundup: St. Joseph’s Prep soccer team tops Archbishop Carroll, stays undefeated
item.description: The Prep is 5-0, including 3-0 against Catholic League opponents.

item.title: Monday’s South Jersey roundup: PJ Panton’s overtime goal lead Burlington Township boys’ soccer past Lenape
item.description: Alexander Petre and Ronaldo Pickering also scored for the Falcons in their victory.

item.title: For these visually impaired golfers, impressive scores are par for the course
item.description: The Junior Blind Golf Association pairs young, visually impaired golfers with professional coaches: “You don’t have to see the ball in order to hit it. In fact, that’s a mistake that sighted golfers make.”

item.title: First-in-a-decade rise in those without health insurance hits children the hardest
item.description: In 2018, 27.5 million American’s did not have health insurance. That’s up 900,000 people from previous year’s number.

item.title: Independence National Park needs a facelift. Now there’s a GoFundMe for that. | Mike Newall
item.description: It's a reasonable $1 million goal, backers say, to fix the most urgent problems in the park.
